qas.question: What day of the week did Churchill and the King meet?
Who did Churchill appoint to Cabinet that the King did not like?
In what month and year did the war start?
Who replaced Winston Churchill as Prime Minister?

context: In 1940, <b5_0>Winston Churchill<b5_0/> replaced <a0_0><b4_0><b7_0>Neville Chamberlain<b7_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> as <a1_0>Prime Minister<a1_0/>, though personally George would have preferred to appoint Lord Halifax. After the King's initial dismay over Churchill's appointment of <a3_0>Lord Beaverbrook<a3_0/> to the Cabinet, he and Churchill developed "the closest personal relationship in modern British history between a monarch and a Prime Minister". Every <a2_0>Tuesday<a2_0/> for four and a half years from <b6_0>September 1940<b6_0/>, the two men met privately for lunch to discuss the war in secret and with frankness.
